RF has dust proof coating on belt to improve longevity, especially in Australia.

products.title: LDO ABS Filament 1.75mm 1kg
products.body_html:
With the high-quality ABS filaments from LDO Motors, you can prepare for the next level of 3D printing! First-class surfaces and sharp details, rounded off with high stiffness and toughness, coupled with high durability and temperature resistance, deliver flawless results that let you experiment in all directions and expand your printing possibilities

Printing Settings

For best results, dry filament using a filament drier before use or print from dryer running or dry box. Keep in an airtight container or included mylar bag for medium/long term storage with silica desiccant. [If you hear popping or inconsistent extrusion while purging filament, suggest drying before printing for best results] Filament Drying Guide

Empty Spool: 158.5g

Nozzle Temperature 220°C - 260°C
Build Plate Temperature 100°C - 110°C
Build Surface Material Works well with most common build surfaces. We recommended PEI Build Plate (Smooth/Texture suitable)
Build Surface Treatment Typically none required. Some surfaces such as glass work best with PVA glue stick or Magigoo .
Enclosure / Heater Chambers

At minimal passive enclosure. 
60-80˚C+ may be required for higher density and larger geometries.

Recommend VOC/Air Filtering/fume extraction or print in well ventilated room with fume extraction. 
Cooling Fan LOW for better surface quality
OFF for better strength
Printing Speed 30 mm/s - 100 mm/s
Retraction The ideal retraction settings vary from printer to printer. If you find the retraction settings are causing gaps in your part, the following settings may help.
Direct Drive: Retraction distance of 0.5 - 1mm with retraction speed of 20mm/s
Bowden: Retraction distance of 2 - 3mm with retraction speed of 20 - 40mm/s
Drying Recommendation  ~50°c for 4-6hrs (Only dry if filament is wet, over drying/repeat drying can damage filament)  (Filament Dryer Guide)
Storage Keeping filament in an airtight container with new/dried desiccant.

Based on 0.5 mm nozzle. Printing conditions may vary with different printers and nozzle diameters.

products.title: FlowTech™ CHT High Flow - CM2™ Nozzle
products.body_html:
Microswiss and Bondtech have partnered to bring the High Flow, Hardened Tip CM2™ nozzle to the FlowTech ecosystem. This new nozzle incorporates proprietary CHT technology, specifically designed to enhance the filament flow rate. Core of the nozzle is made of high-temperature Copper Chromium Zirconium and plated with an Electroless Nickel Plating. This special alloy retains its strength at much higher temperatures compared to a regular copper alloy. The tip of the nozzle is made of M2 Hardened High Speed Steel and coated with a special  WS2 nonstick nano coating.

CHT - CM2™ Nozzle Features:

  • Copper Chromium Zirconium body
    • Plated with an Electroless Nickel Plating

  • M2 Hardened High Speed Steel insert
    • Plated with an Electroless Nickel Plating
    • Coated with nonstick nano WS2 coating.
    • Coefficient of friction: 0.035
    • Heat-treated hardness:  68 HRC
  • High Flow CHT Technology
    • The FlowTech nozzle, equipped with Bondtech CHT technology, can achieve a maximum volumetric flow rate of up to 50 mm³/sec 
    • More uniform layer deposition is achieved by splitting the filament  flow into multiple chambers as it passes through the melt zone. This reduces gaps and weak points between layers
  • Orifice size available: .4mm, .6mm, .8mm, 1.0mm

  • Limited lifetime warranty against wear
    Warranty


Made in Sweden by Bondtech
Assembled in USA by Microswiss

Supported Hotends:

  • FlowTech™ Hotend for Creality K1 / K1 Max / K1C (M3101)
  • FlowTech™ Hotend for Creality CR-10 SE (M3102)
  • FlowTech™ Hotend for Creality Ender 3 V3 KE (M3103)

Documentation: 

Note: This heat break is not best suited extensive abrasive such as CF/GF filled filaments.

Thermal paste between the copper section(cold end) with heat sink is unnecessary if you're printing below 280 degrees when using all metal hotend but is recommend by manufacturer.

In our in house testing, the measurable surface temperature is within marginal of error and still well below standard compare to a metal heat break. We recommend GD900 or AG Silver Thermal Paste Sachet or AG Thermal Paste.

products.title: Sunon 24V 4010 Magnetic Suspension Bearing Axial Cooling Fan
products.body_html:
Sunon's MF40102VX-1Q03C-A99 is a compact 24V axial fan engineered for 3D printers and similar applications where airflow is required. Featuring magnetic suspension bearing technology, it delivers 11 CFM airflow at 10,000 RPM with higher than typical noise (36.8 dBA). Rated for 60,000 hours at 40°C and 65% humidity, this low-power unit (1.92W) operates across -10°C to 60°C. Not recommended for active enclosed systems due to temperature constraints; expect reduced lifespan in high-heat environments. Compact 40×40×10mm form factor suits tight mounting spaces.

Specification; 

  • Model: MF40102VX-1Q03C-A99
  • Note: Not suitable for active enclosed printers, rated operating temp range -10c-60c, please refer to attached datasheet. Suitable for open printers, or may expect shorter life expectancy
  • Life: 60,000 Hours at 40 deg. C, 65% humidity, 90% CL.
  • Size: 40*40*10mm
  • Voltage: DC24V
  • Current: 0.088A
  • Power: 1.92W
  • Speed: 10000RPM+- 10%
  • Noise: 36.8DBA
  • Weight:15.6G
  • Bearing: magnetic suspension bearing
  • Air Pressure: 0.29 mmH20

  • Airflow : 11 CFM

Sunon recommended no PWM is used

Datasheet

Documentation:

As it Maglev/Vapo bearing is not suitable to mounted fan facing down as it fan bearing can quickly degrade, in setup down such as mainboard cooling. 

Cable Length (~24cm) Please ensure polarity is correct when installing the fan. This is classified as advance kit as it require either crimping new connection skills or joining two wire via soldering sleeves for instance as 30 cm in most case is not long enough to reach from hotend to mainboard but quite suitable for enclosure fan(mounted fan facing up) or for toolhead with breakout board or can board.

Do note, this is higher sound volume than most stock fans but performs and last significantly longer than traditional bearings(Sleeves Bearings). These fans are much more suitable for component cooling for high flow hotends/all metal hotends, it can generate a significantly higher air pressure and airflow.

products.title: Bondtech CHT BiMetal RepRap V6 Coated Nozzle - Hardened Vanadium Steel
products.body_html:
This Bondtech CHT BiMetal ™ RepRap M6 nozzle increases the melting capacity of your hotend, to build faster and to save your time. It also improves the layer adhesion of your 3D prints to create stronger parts. Important to notice this nozzle is resistant to particle or fiber loaded abrasive materials.

Increase the Max Volumetric Flow of your RepRap M6 style heat block by 50%

Nozzle is supplied with Nickel Coating. [First Photo is how nozzle looks before coating, second photo is actual nozzle appearance after coating] 

They are manufactured by Bondtech in-house, and will fit the following blocks/printers:

  • Mosquito® / Magnum
  • Mosquito® Liquid
  • Mosquito® Magnum+
  • Copperhead™
  • E3D Chimera and Kraken
  • E3D V4, V5 and V6 blocks
  • Prusa i3, Prusa Mini
  • RepRap M6

 

ALERT : Avoid Cold Change Of Bondtech CHT Nozzles

Heat up the heat block up to 280C, or at least above 250C, before removing or tightening any Bondtech CHT nozzle. Use at most 1 Nm torque. Recommended Torque is 0.5 Nm.

ALERT : Size limitation for fiber loaded filaments

For Carbon or Glass fiber loaded abrasive filaments use only 0.6, 0.8 and 1.0mm nozzle size.

ALERT : For particle loaded filaments

For metal, wood, glitter or other particle loaded abrasive filaments you may use the 0.4mm nozzle size.

Features

    • Copper body;
    • Hardened Vanadium Steel inserts;
    • Nickel Coating;
    • 1 unit per pack;
    • Available sizes : 0.40, 0.60, 0.80, and 1.0mm;
    • Optimized for 1.75mm filament;
    • Compatible with 2.85mm filament.
    • Requires 6mm wrench'
    • 4 units pack (0.40, 0.60, 0.80, and 1.0mm)

Bondtech CHT BiMetal RepRap Coated Nozzle Advantages

  • Abrasive-proof to work with Carbon and Glass fiber composite materials;
  • Higher melt capacity by increasing the surface area of the heating walls
  • Flow Rate gains between 25 and 65% (check picture with test data)
  • Competitive price/performance price
  • Machined with ultra-precision
  • Copper body and Hardened Vanadium Steel inserts nozzle with Nickel coated surface
  • Follows nozzle standard:
    • RepRap M6 (M6×1×7.5×12.5)
  • May be used with 1.75 or 2.85mm hotends.

Flow Rate gains may vary. Results depend on the hardware, materials and print settings used.

products.title: VLMP 2 Heat Set Insert Press Hardware Kit
products.body_html:
The VLMP 2 represents a refined evolution of its predecessor, engineered for professionals who demand consistency and precision. This robust insert press delivers the structural integrity and accuracy required for reliable, repeatable heat set operations across production runs. Built for durability and performance, it's the choice for users seeking industrial-grade results in a compact form factor.

  1. Direct and easy upgrade from VLMP 1 (upgrade kit).
  2. Fully enclosed idler to prevent belt hop.
  3. Wider base for greater stability.
  4. Accessible storage for inserts.
  5. Fully covered and adjustable counterweight.
  6. Aggressive aesthetic design.
  7. Cost effective parts for easy spares and repairs.

Digital Files will be automatically emailed once hardware kit has been shipped. [Sometimes its can be filtered in spam, if you did not get email, please reach out with order number and we will re-emailed the download link]

Assembly Video: Video

Guide: [Will be included with your digital files downloads]

What is Included: 

Hardware Kit:

  1. All hardware needed for assembly (Does not include soldering iron)
  2. STLs for printed parts (digital files will be emailed once hardware order has been fulfilled) (Pre-Printed Parts are not included)

 Not included

  1. Tools for assembly
  2. filament or printed parts
  3. Soldering Iron

Note: If you require printed parts or soldering iron, please contact us for quote. 

Digital Files License

The license for files included with this purchase permit you do download and print them, and also modify them for personal use, but you may not redistribute them, nor sell or trade printed parts.

Soldering Iron (Not Included)

For the soldering iron we recommend the Handskit 927 with the CNC Kitchen M900 Tips or Pencil + CNC Kitchen Inserts. The 927/Pencil is great as it doesn't require a separate base station, is adjustable in small increments, has a built in display and sleeps after a short period just in case you leave it on by accident. The correct size tips ensure your iron won't get stuck on the inserts too, a must have.

If you want to purchase a separate soldering iron, here are a few tips to help you get a suitable model.

  • Ensure it can reach around 300C or the melting point +30C of the plastic you want inserts pressed into.
  • Ensure the iron uses common exchangeable tips such as those by CNCKitchen.
  • Ensure it has accurate temperature control with read-out
  • Ensure the iron has an on/off switch.
  • Additionally soldering stations with removable soldering irons may be a useful option.

Grip Information:

  • The grip ideally needs to be printed from ABS and be just the right size for your soldering iron.
  • You get the Autodesk fusion CAD file (and common STLs) for the grip with your purchase as the grip itself is an open source design. We also have a database that stores common sizes for various soldering iron models so you can make it yourself in just the right size.
  • For the easiest route, we sell grips for the VLMP soldering iron (Handskit 927) made from ABS and guaranteed to work. If you have a grip from VLMP 1, this will work too.
  • Once you have a good grip size for your iron, be sure to share it to our database to help others too by filling in this form.

Product History: 

Note: Orders after 1 May 2024 are shipping VLMP 2. [ Upgrade kit from VLMP 1 Listing (https://store.dremc.com.au/products/vlmp-2-upgrade-kit)]

products.title: LDO Orbiter Extruder Kit V2.0
products.body_html:
A high precision, light weight, direct drive, planetary extruder system. (DREMC is an official Reseller/Distributor )

A design by Dr. Lorincz Rober in cooperation with LDO. For more information visit https://orbiterprojects.com/.

Filament Sensor Add-on: https://store.dremc.com.au/products/orbiter-extruder-v2-0-filament-sensor

Assembled completed Orbiter V2.0 Extruder with LDO-36STH20-1004AH high temperature pancake stepper motor

Ender 3 Epogee Guide: https://docs.ldomotors.com/en/orbiter/apogee/installation_guide

https://store.dremc.com.au/products/orbiter-extruder-v2-0-filament-sensor?utm_source=copyToPasteBoard&utm_medium=product-links&utm_content=web

Improvements and features over previous versions of Orbiter:

  • Shorter hardened drive gears 11mm vs 15mm manufactured by Bondtech
  • Weight reduced to ~135 grams
  • Smaller more compact dimensions (11.6% shorter)
  • New motor design offers ~40% increase in extrusion force in real printing conditions and much improved acceleration performance
  • Flipped drive gears – filament path closer to the extruder center for a more balanced design and perfect fit on delta printers as well
  • Stainless steel filament exit guide with 0.2-0.3mm clearance to drive gears for best TPU printing experience and extreme wear resistance when using abrasive filaments.
  • High temperature resistant housings, GPA12
  • Machined PEEK secondary drive gear sleeve
  • Tension mechanism with grab screw design
  • Mounting screws in line with filament exit path – improving housing stiffness and easier mounting
  • Perfectly aligned filament path
  • New smaller and more stylish PTFE tube input coupler
  • Motor position rotated by additional 10 degrees for easier maintenance and assembly
  • Extremely low backlash ~0.06mm
  • Filament sensor add on with auto load and unload button add on feature
  • And many more small changes to improve mechanical accuracy and design look

Basic Configuration

  • Steps: 690 steps/mm @ 16 micro-stepping
  • Max. instantaneous speed change (jerk): 600mm/min(RRF), 10mm/s (Marlin) (recommended 300/5)
  • Pressure advance: 0.02~0.03s – to be calibrated
  • Retraction: 1~1.5mm – to be calibrated
  • Retraction speed: 120mm/s, reduce it to 30mm/s when printing TPU
  • Motor current: 1.2A Peak or 0.85A RMS (LDO-36STH20-1004AHG)
  • Max. acceleration: 8000 mm/s2 *
  • Normal motor operating temperature: 65-75°C
  • Drive motor with stealth chop disabled!

* The extruder itself without filament can handle acceleration up to 25000mm/s2. Adding weight of the filament it drags along its recommended to have acceleration limit set not above 8000mm/s2. To reduce clicking noise of the extruder (due to fast direction change) you may limit acceleration to 3000mm/s2

For more information please visit the Orbiter website here:

Orbiter v2.0

Documentation: https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000302922-ldo-orbiter-extruder-kit-v2-0

products.title: V6 Compatible Titanium Alloy Heat Break 1.75mm by Trianglelab
products.body_html:
High quality Triangle Lab GRADE 5 titanium alloy heat break. This material is used specifically in the aerospace industry and has a lower thermal conductivity than stainless steel. Due to the lower thermal conductivity, a better defined melting zone is possible.

The extremely smooth surface structure significantly increases the reliability in extrusion. Less blockages and lower extrusion forces are also another positive advantage of the smooth surfaces.

The V6 heat breaks are compatible with all E3D V6 hotends and original Prusa i3 devices or other V6 clones. For Prusa MMU, our recommenced is Prusa specific Heat Break. 

What is Include:

Compatibility

products.title: PT1000 Pro High temperature thermistor (450°C) M4 / M3 Screw In
products.body_html:
The PT1000 Pro High temperature thermistor measures temperatures up to 450°C and fits into M4/M3 screw-in models. It is the ideal choice for high-temperature applications, offering reliable, accurate readings. Its sturdy design ensures long-term reliability.

  • High Temperature PT1000 Sensor up to 450°C, it possible without amplifier board with default 4.7k pull up resistor but will get lower accuracy. To get full benefits you will need board that supports PT1000 by default like some Bigtreetech boards or replace the 4.7K pullup resister of the thermistor pins with a included 1K 0.1% resister, require SMD soldering. 
  • High Accuracy within 1%

NOTE: Should only be hand tightened while module is not connected to the extension wire. Depending on batch, style of M3 screw may differ from pictured. 

Specs:

  • Extension Cable: 2M
  • Thermistor : PT1000
  • Thermistor Screw in: M4 or M3.

Additional Compatibility: 


M4 is suitable for replacement Rapido V2 hotend(Note: Double check your heater block, as newer V2 may be using bare style available here), while M3 is suitable for most heater blocks existing retaining thermistor such as MK8/V6/Volcano heater blocks or Mellow vz goliath Hotend. We cannot guarantee compatible with clone blocks, as they may differ in threading pitch or size.  

Note: As this is molex connector, ensure you plug in to correct quick connector if plan to use as long side DRHOTSWAP or if you using molex as quick connector for your hotend. 

Documentation: 

Firmware changes required in most case which coming from other thermeristor type.

For Klipper: 

Default 4.7Kpullup resistor, set thermistor type to PT1000. 

 

For Duet2 Wifi

M308 S1 P"e0temp" Y"pt1000" R2000 ;two 1K resistors in series for better accuracy

 

Marlin:

Default 4.7Kpullup resistor please choose sensor '1047'
If you have replaced pullup with 1K resistor please choose sensor '1010'

Configuration.h:
*1047 : Pt1000 with 4k7 pullup

products.title: Revo™ Nozzle Tip Socks
products.body_html:
Swap your 3D printer’s nozzles in less than 60 seconds without tools or hot tightening – just use your fingers! If you can unscrew a tube of toothpaste, you can use a Revo Nozzle. Just screw one in to any Revo cold side and you’re ready to 3D print.

  • Compatible with Revo cold sides, including Revo Six, Revo Micro, and Revo Hemera
  • No need to hot tighten – each Revo Nozzle is a factory-assembled nozzle and heatbreak in one
  • Works with a Revo HeaterCore for faster heat-ups and greater efficiency than most HotEnds on the market
  • Compatible with popular FDM 3D printers, such as Creality, Ender, Prusa, Anet, Biqu, Monoprice, and many more

Experiment freely. With nozzle swapping this easy, you’re free to experiment with nozzle sizes you might not have used before. Set your 3D printer up for ultra-fine or ultra-thick extrusion widths in no time at all. Print large objects in less time, or tiny objects with high resolution.

Frustration-free. Each Revo Nozzle is a preassembled nozzle and heatbreak in one unit, so there’s no hazardous hot tightening and no chance of incorrect assembly. Say goodbye to frustrating HotEnd leaks and enjoy reliable 3D printing!

Rapid identification. Identify nozzle sizes at a glance thanks to a colour-coded silicone sock. Plus, each Revo Nozzle has its size engraved into it with easy-to-read numbers, so there are no confusing identification markers to learn!

An expanding range. We’re ready to make RapidChange Nozzles in any size. At launch, we’re introducing brass nozzles in 0.25mm, 0.4mm, 0.6mm and 0.8mm, with many more compatible nozzles to follow later. Wear-resistant and high flow variants are already on our roadmap and will follow over time.

products.title: Micro Swiss NG™ Direct Drive Extruder for Creality Ender 5 / 5 Pro / 5 Plus
products.body_html:
Designed specifically for the Ender 5 Series—including Ender 5, Ender 5 Pro, and Ender 5 Plus—this extruder addresses the limitations of existing models to deliver an improved printing performance. Its Bevel Gear design enables the industry's shortest filament path, measuring less than 41mm. Additionally, the innovative motor placement ensures a compact, low-overhang structure, enhancing overall system stiffness and reliability.

Features:

  • Lightweight

  • 3:1 Gear ratio

  • Adaptable to wide range of 3D Printers

  • Hardened steel, precision cut Dual Gear drive

  • Industry shortest, highly constrained, TwinClad XT™ plated filament path

  • Bevel Gear system allows a low overhang extruder mount

  • Integrated with a Micro Swiss All Metal Hotend

Made in USA by Micro Swiss

Support Printers:

  • Ender 5
  • Ender 5 Pro
  • Ender 5 Plus

What is included:

  • 1x Master Extruder Assembly 
  • 1x Adaptation plate
  • 1x Stepper motor
  • 1x Fan Shroud
  • 1x Custom extension cable
  • 1x Hotend assembly
  • 1x Printed Endstop Bracket
  • 1x Printed BLTouch bracket

Hardware:

  • 1x Eccentric nut
  • 1x M5 x .8 x 30mm CAP SCREW
  • 1x 5mm ID 10mm OD Washer
  • 1x M5 x .8 Nylon Lock Nut
  • 2x M5 x .8 x 20mm Nylon Patch CAP SCREWs
  • 4x M2.2 x 8mm Thread Forming Screw for Plastic
  • 4x M3 x 12mm Thread Forming Screw for Plastic
  • 1x 7mm spanner wrench

Installation Instructions - PDF

By Daniel at ModBot

products.title: Bigtreetech Eddy Sensor
products.body_html:
• 𝐇𝐢𝐠𝐡 𝐀𝐜𝐜𝐮𝐫𝐚𝐜𝐲: Offers meticulous measurements with an accuracy of 0.0005mm.
  • 𝐇𝐢𝐠𝐡-𝐒𝐩𝐞𝐞𝐝 𝐋𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠: Completes bed leveling in just 20 seconds on a typical size printer.
  • 𝐅𝐞𝐚𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐫-𝐋𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭 & 𝐂𝐨𝐦𝐩𝐚𝐜𝐭: Lightweight at 6g, reducing the influence of motion inertia, while its compact size ensures broad compatibility.
  • 𝐓𝐞𝐦𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞 𝐂𝐨𝐦𝐩𝐞𝐧𝐬𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧: Integrates with Klipper's temperature compensation feature to boost leveling precision and avoid temperature drift. (𝐍𝐨𝐭𝐞: Currently, only Eddy V1.0 supports temperature compensation, not Eddy Coil.)
  • What sets Eddy apart is its custom-engineered casing, designed to eliminate the worry of reserving space for installation! Specifically, it's perfectly sized for tool-free installation on the 𝐎𝐦𝐫𝐨𝐧 𝐓𝐋-𝐐𝟓𝐌𝐂𝟐 & 𝐏𝐋-𝟎𝟖𝐍 𝐦𝐨𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐬 of the 𝐕𝐨𝐫𝐨𝐧 𝐒𝐭𝐞𝐚𝐥𝐭𝐡𝐛𝐮𝐫𝐧𝐞𝐫.
  • Max operating condition: <60c

Documentation:

https://github.com/bigtreetech/Eddy

Compatible Products:

  • Eddy V1.0 + BIGTREETECH Pi 2 / Pi
  • Eddy V1.0 + Manta M8P + CB2 / CB1
  • Eddy V1.0 + Manta E3EZ + CB2 / CB1
  • Eddy V1.0 + Octopus MaxEZ + BIGTREETECH Pi 2 / Pi
  • Eddy Coil + EBB 36 CAN
  • Eddy Coil + EBB 42 CAN

𝐍𝐨𝐭𝐞: The spring steel sheet with a magnetic sticker heatbed solution works well with Eddy series, however it is essential to avoid interference from standalone magnets, such as those used in circular magnet heatbed configurations.

products.title: Creality K1 Black Texture PEI  Build Plate 235*235mm
products.body_html:
The Creality K1 Black Texture PEI Build Plate (235 x 235mm) provides a durable, heat-resistant surface ideal for PETG, TPU, ABS, ASA (with enclosure), and PLA (may need adhesive or brim). For PLA, using the PC side is recommended.

Features:

  • Textured Surface (PC and PEI) (PEI is rougher textured, while the PC is lighter textured)
  • PLA prints with small contact area may require brim on textured PEI.
  • No adhesive is required for PETG on textured PEI
  • First layer may require more squished on textured PEI compare to PC textured side

What is Included:

  • 1x Creality Double PEI/PC Texture PEI 
  • 1x Spare Magnetic Sheet 

Note 1: one side is texture PEI while other is PC texture sticker 

Note 2: If you have issues with adhesive use bed adhesive on PEI, some filament will require bed adhesive. If un-sure please reach out to support. 

Note 3: As always setting up new build surface, re-configure your z off-set and re-level your bed. (ie when you switch between smooth/texture). 

Printer Compatibility:

  • Ender 3 S1
  • Ender 3 S1 Pro
  • Ender 5 S1
  • Creality K1
  • Ender 3
  • Ender 3 pro
  • Ender 3s
  • Ender 5
  • CR20 PRO/CR20
  • Ender 5 Pro
  • Other Ender 3 Clone but we cannot confirm compatible on every clone that release every couple of months. Please measure your stock bed and buy according to your existing bed size.
